intro: Vauquelinia corymbosa subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf vauquelinia, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits. Its foliage remains evergreen throughout the year, providing year-round visual interest in the landscape.
